ocean.gui
Class OceanCanvas

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Canvas
          ocean.gui.OceanCanvas
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class OceanCanvas
extends java.awt.Canvas

An ocean with plenty of fish and some nice goodies.

Constructor Detail

OceanCanvas

public OceanCanvas(FishWindow fishWindow,
                   int h,
                   int w)
Construct an empty ocean-drawing area with the given dimension (measured in fish).

Parameters:
fishWindow - The Window commanding the Ocean.
h - Height in number of fish.
w - Width in number of fish.
Method Detail

setMatrix

public void setMatrix(FishMatrix newMatrix)
Set new contents. The matrix automatically gets copied.

Parameters:
newMatrix - Matrix containing the fish or null for water squares.

public void setGrid(boolean b)
Set if you want a grid to be painted.

Parameters:
b - Do you want a grid?

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Paint the ocean. Since we use double buffering we only have to redisplay the buffer. Create a buffer when called for the first time.

Overrides:
paint in class java.awt.Canvas
Parameters:
g - Graphics object to paint into.

update

public void update(java.awt.Graphics g)
Repaint everything. Does not clear the canvas before painting as it gets completely overwritten.

Overrides:
update in class java.awt.Canvas
Parameters:
g - Graphics object to paint into.
